title: Smokey Chicken Thighs with Yellow Rice

instructions: Heat a drizzle of oil in a small pot over medium heat. Add half the turmeric (all for 4 servings) and half the smoked paprika (you’ll use the rest later); cook, stirring occasionally, until fragrant, 30 seconds. • Add rice, stock concentrates, 1¼ cups water (2¼ cups for 4), and a pinch of salt. Bring to a boil, then cover and reduce to a low simmer. Cook until rice is tender, 15-20 minutes. Keep covered off heat until ready to use in Step 5.

While rice cooks, wash and dry produce. • Halve, peel, and thinly slice half the onion (whole onion for 4 servings). Halve lemon. Dice tomato into ½-inch pieces. Peel and mince or grate garlic. Pick cilantro leaves from stems.

In a small microwave-safe bowl, combine sliced onion, ½ tsp sugar, juice from half the lemon, and a pinch of salt (1 tsp sugar and juice from whole lemon for 4 servings). • Cover with plastic wrap and microwave until onion is softened, 30-60 seconds. Set aside.

Open package of chicken* and drain off any excess liquid. • Heat a drizzle of oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add chicken in an even layer; season with remaining smoked paprika, salt, and pepper. Cook, undisturbed, until lightly browned on the bottom, 2-3 minutes. • Add tomato and garlic; continue to cook, stirring occasionally, until chicken is cooked through and tomato is slightly softened, 3-5 minutes more.
Fluff rice with a fork. • To pan with chicken, add rice and peas; stir to combine. Taste and season with salt if desired.

Divide chicken and rice between shallow bowls. Top with cilantro leaves and as much pickled onion (draining first) as you like. Serve.

Chicken is fully cooked when internal temperature reaches 165°.

about: A spin on arroz con pollo (“rice with chicken”) is just another entry into the upper echelon of iconic duos. Ready in just 30 minutes, you’ll season and sizzle chicken thighs with smoky paprika, then arrange them on a bed of fluffy rice tinged with earthy turmeric and dotted with peas. Piquant pickled red onions and fragrant cilantro add further pops of freshness to this hearty, classic meal. Serving amount is 2 dishes.

title: 6 minute seared Ahi Tuna Steaks

instructions: Pat Ahi Tuna Steaks dry
Mix Soy Sauce, Toasted Sesame Oil, Honey, Kosher Salt (If desired), Black Pepper, and Cayenne Pepper
Mix until the honey is fully dissolved
Marinate the Tuna for as little as 15 min up to overnight
Preheat a skillet on medium-high heat
Add canola oil (Any neutral oil will do) the pan
Sear Tuna Steaks for 1 - 1.75 minutes per side depending on how done you like your tuna

about: A quick and easy dinner recipe that pairs great with rice! You can even save the marinade from the tuna and drizzle it onto the rice for added flavor for your entire meal. /n/n There is always a risk when consuming raw or undercooked fish.  Tuna is normally served 'rare' or 'medium-rare' but this does not mean there is zero risk.

title: Jo Mama's Spaghetti

ingredients.name: Italian Sausage, Casing removed (Mild or Hot)

instructions: In large stockpot brown italian sausage, breaking it apart as you stir
Add onions and continue cooking, stirring occasionally until onions are soft
Add garlic, tomatoes, tomato paste, tomato sauce, and water. Stir until mostly combined
Add basil, parsley, brown sugar, salt, crushed red pepper flakes, and black pepper
Stir well to combine, bring to a boil
If using Red Wine, stir in now
Reduce burner temperature until sauce is at a low simmer, stirring frequently for at least 1 hour. Here a longer simmer means more flavor and a better sauce, be careful not to let it burn
When sauce is ready cook spaghetti noodles according the instructions on the box
Sppon sauce over drained spaghetti noodles

about: The difficulty in this recipe is more a function of how long it takes for a good simmer which means a long time watching and stirring the sauce. My kids will give up a steak dinner for this spaghetti. It is a recipe I have been perfecting for years and it is so good (if I may humbly say) that my kids are disappointed when they eat spaghetti anywhere else but home!

title: Tteokbokki (Korean Spicy Rice Cake)

instructions: Soak the Rice cakes for about 20 minutes
Cut the fish cake, scallions, and cabbage into approximately 2 inch long pieces
In a large pan add the Anchocy Broth, Gochujang, Gochugaru, Soy Sauce, Sugar, and Corn Syrup
Stir to combine the ingredients until the Gochugaru has completely dissolved.
Add the rice cakes, bring to a boil and cook for 8-10 minutes. Stir frequently to prevent sticking
Drop in the fish cake, scallions, and cabbage and stir for another 4-6 minutes
When rice cakes are soft and the sauce is nice and thick remove from heat and server

about: Literally translated as “stir-fried rice cake,” tteokbokki (떡볶이) is a beloved Korean rice cake dish with many variations and a rich history.  It’s also spelled ddukbokki, ddeokbokki, dukbokki or topokki. This spicy rice cake dish is enormously popular as a street food and also often enjoyed at home. Unlike gungjung tteokbokki, which has been around for hundreds of years, the red spicy tteokbokki has a relatively short history. It was developed in 1953, the year the Korean War ended, by a woman named Ma Bok-rim in the Sindang-dong neighborhood in Seoul. The chewy rice cake in a spicy gochujang sauce instantly became popular as an affordable comfort snack.

title: Honey Sriracha Oven Baked Salmon

instructions: Preheat Oven to 425 F
Line a cooking tray with Aluminum foil and lay salmon skin side down
Season salmon with Kosher Salt and Fresh Black Pepper
Place salmon into oven and cook for 10 minutes
in a pot add the Neutral Oil, Garlic, Sriracha, Soy Sauce, Honey, and Rice Vinegar
Bring sauce to a boil then lower heat to low simmer
Cook for 8-10 minutes or until sauce has thickened
Take salmon out of the oven and brush it with the sauce
Bake salmon once more for an additional 8-10 minutes

It’s also spelled ddukbokki, ddeokbokki, dukbokki or topokki. This spicy rice cake dish is enormously popular as a street food and also often enjoyed at home. The chewy rice cake in a spicy gochujang sauce instantly became popular as an affordable comfort snack.

instructions: Preheat Oven to 425 F
Line a cooking tray with Aluminum foil, lightly coat with oil or non-stick spray
Melt butter in a bowl
Stir in Old Bay, Garlic and Herb Seasoning, Lemon juice, and sea salt
Place salmon filets on foil covered try
Season with freshly ground Black Pepper to taste
Lightly spoon butter sauce onto each filet
Bake at 425 F for approximately 11-13 minutes
